    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static boolean isLoginCredentialsSet
      A static field, initialized with false, to hold the information
      if all needed credentials to log into an e621.net account were set.
      private static java.lang.String PasswordHash
      A static field, initialized with an empty string, to hold the e621.net account password hash.
      private static java.lang.String Username
      A static field, initialized with an empty string, to hold the e621.net account username.

      • isLoginCredentialsSet

        public static final boolean isLoginCredentialsSet()
        A public method to retrieve the status if account-credentials were set.
        Returns:
        the casual statement if credentials were set by setLoginCredentials(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
        Since:
        1.0

      • getPasswordHash

        protected static final java.lang.String getPasswordHash()
        A protected method to retrieve the (SHA1 hashed) e621.net account password.
        Returns:
        The SHA1 password-hash from the set of credentials,
        or an empty string if no credentials being set.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getUsername

        protected static final java.lang.String getUsername()
        A protected method to retrieve the e621.net account username.
        Returns:
        The username from the set of credentials,
        or an empty string if no credentials being set.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setPasswordHash

        private static final void setPasswordHash(java.lang.String PasswordHash)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        A private method to set the string value to the field PasswordHash
        Parameters:
        PasswordHash - A string consisting of the e621.net account password (hashed to SHA1).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Is thrown when an empty string is being supplied.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setUsername

        A private method to set the string value to the field Username
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Is thrown when an empty string is being supplied.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setLoginCredentialsSet

        private static final void setLoginCredentialsSet(java.lang.Boolean isSet)
        A private method to set the boolean value to the field isLoginCredentialsSet,
        if the full set of credentials are being
        set by setLoginCredentials(String, String).
        Parameters:
        isSet - A boolean value, telling if the complete credentials were set.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setLoginCredentials

        public final void setLoginCredentials(java.lang.String Username,
                       java.lang.String Password)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        The public method allows all subclasses to set e621.net login-credentials to be used by further API functions.
        It throws exceptions accordingly if anything goes wrong,
        and sets isLoginCredentialsSet to true at the end to ensure
        setting of the fields Username and PasswordHash was successful.
        Parameters:
        Username - A String consisting of the e621.net account username.
        Password - A String consisting of the e621.net cleartext account password.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Is thrown when either a blank username or password is being supplied.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - Is thrown when the password can't be hashed, because the required SHA1 digest is not available to the system.
        Since:
        1.0

      • HashSHA1

        protected final java.lang.String HashSHA1(java.lang.String InputString)
                                   throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        A method to hash the supplied String using SHA1 digest.
        If an empty string is supplied, the method returns prematurely an empty string, skipping all logic.
        Parameters:
        InputString - Any String to be hashed
        Returns:
        The SHA1 hashed inputString or an empty string, if the provided input was also empty.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - Throws when SHA1 digest is not available to the system.
        Since:
        1.0
